records.where_clear: Samos hotspot and Vathy town, Samos island
records.uncertainty_note: Coordinates are 0.0, but textual description is clear.
records.context_note: Continuous disturbances in Samos hotspot and Vathy town. Migrants protested bad living conditions, set fire, and clashed with authorities. Situation returned to normal by evening.
records.evidence_quote: Continuous disturbances in Samos hotspot and 'After the migrants from 1st boat were fully screened, HP tried to transport them to the camp, but unfortunately they had to return because a group of Africans started fire once again when they saw the transportation van; Also another big group of the migrants just descended from the camp to Vathy town to protest against the bad living conditions at the reception centre; They are heading towards HCG premises where registration is taking place.'

records.where_clear: Samos island, specifically Eastern Samos, likely Vathy town or near the camp
records.uncertainty_note: Coordinates are 0.0, but textual description is clear.
records.context_note: Protest against Frontex on Samos island, organized by local community and authorities, due to bad living conditions at the camp and slow transfers to mainland. Mayor of Eastern Samos called for action.
records.evidence_quote: Protest against Frontex at Samos island and 'Text Removed - Justification 4 informed that Text Removed - Justification 4 became aware of a protest which will take place against Frontex in Samos today (Saturday 19/10).'

records.where_clear: Samos island, specifically Vathy town and the camp
records.uncertainty_note: Coordinates are 0.0, but textual description is clear.
records.context_note: Fight between migrant groups and a big fire on Samos island. The fight started in Vathy, involving Syrian and Afghan nationals, resulting in 3 stabbings. Police used tear gas at the camp. No fire-related injuries reported.
records.evidence_quote: On 14 October at 21:00 a fight between different gorups of migrants started at Samos. In addition, a big fire occurred in the area. and '3 people were stabbed and transported to the hospital.'

records.uncertainty_note: Coordinates are 0.0, but textual description is clear.
records.context_note: Protesting migrants set fires inside and outside Moria camp, Lesvos, demanding transfer to mainland. One Afghan woman died in the fire. Migrants clashed with police and firefighters. Several people were hospitalized, despite the 'Injured persons' field stating 0.
records.evidence_quote: Protesting migrants have set fire inside and outside the Moria camp, demanding to be transferred to the mainland. and 'One woman (AFG) died in the fire.'

records.where_clear: North of Oinousses, near Chios island
records.geocodable_query: North of Oinousses, Chios island, Greece
records.uncertainty_note: Coordinates are 0.0, but textual description is clear.
records.context_note: A capsized boat was detected north of Oinousses, near Chios island. 12 persons were rescued. Initially, 2 corpses were recovered and 4 persons were missing, but later all 4 missing persons were found dead, bringing the total dead to 6. A SAR operation was launched. One facilitator (TUR) was arrested.
records.evidence_quote: A capsized boat was detected by Text Removed - Justification 6 in the area north of Oinousses (near Chios island). 12 persons have been rescued and 2 corpses have been recovered. and 'At 13:45 LT HCG was informed that all missing 4 persons were found dead under the capsized boat.'

records.uncertainty_note: Coordinates are 0.0, but textual description is clear.
records.context_note: A dead female Syrian migrant (60-70 years old) was found in a boat with 13 other Syrian migrants in the Kokkari area of Samos. The other migrants claimed she had died an hour before landing. The body was transported to Samos hospital, and the migrants to R.I.C. Samos. Police investigation is ongoing.
records.evidence_quote: One dead body was found in Samos in a boat and 'A female migrant was discovered already dead in the boat (SYR, age 60-70).'

records.where_clear: Moria RIC (Reception and Identification Centre), Lesvos island
records.uncertainty_note: Coordinates are 0.0, but textual description is clear.
records.context_note: A fight between three Afghan minors (14 and 15 years old) in Moria RIC, Lesvos, resulted in one minor being stabbed to death. The other two minors were injured and transferred to Mytilini hospital. Police investigation is ongoing.
records.evidence_quote: Minor killed in Moria RIC - Lesvos and '3 Afghan minors (14 and 15 years old) started fighting in Moria RIC and one of them died after being stabbed. The other two migrants have been injured and were transferred to Mytilini hospital.'

records.where_clear: Near Agathonisi island, Samos, within Greek territorial waters (GTW)
records.context_note: A Turkish patrol vessel conducted hostile maneuvers against a Frontex asset (Text Removed - Justification 6) inside Greek territorial waters near Agathonisi island, Samos, while the Frontex asset was identifying Turkish fishing vessels. The Frontex asset was forced to change course to avoid a collision. The dangerous maneuvers put the crew's safety at risk.
records.evidence_quote: Hostile maneuvers by TUR patrol vessel vs Text Removed - Justification 6 and 'At 13:32 LT, the Turkish CPB Text Removed - Justification 5 approached them conducting hostile maneuvers versus the Text Removed - Justification 6, inside of GTW.'

records.where_clear: Hospital (location not specified, but likely near the operation area 'Poseidon Sea 2019')
records.context_note: A Frontex staff member (Text Removed - Justification 4) was hospitalized for throat inflammation and underwent tonsillitis surgery. This is a medical incident involving a staff member.
records.evidence_quote: Text Removed - Justification 4, went last evening to the hospital because of a throat inflammation, this morning at 2am a surgery of tonsillitis (amigdalite) was performed.

records.where_clear: Pamfila sea area, east side of Lesvos island
records.context_note: A capsized boat was spotted in the Pamfila sea area, east of Lesvos island. A SAR operation rescued 57 migrants and recovered 7 dead bodies (4 women, 1 man, 2 children). The SAR operation is ongoing for possible further detections.
records.evidence_quote: Capsized boat, East of Lesvos. 57 migrants rescued and 07 dead bodies recovered and 'On 11 June 2019, at 06:45, a capsized boat was spotted by Text Removed - Justification 6 at Pamfila sea area, east side of Lesvos island.'
